intro: Pearcea bilabiata, commonly known as the two-lipped pearcea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth surface and a prominent midrib. The flowers, which are usually pink or purple, are bilaterally symmetrical and have two distinct lips, giving the plant its common name.
